intro: Jacobaea erucifolia subsp. praealta, commonly known as the tall tansy, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Europe. It features a rosette of basal leaves that are aromatic and covered in fine hairs. The plant produces yellow composite flowers in a single terminal head, typical of the Asteraceae family. It thrives in sunny, well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or grassy habitats. Its leaves contain compounds that have been historically used for their medicinal and pesticidal properties.
